content: Homepage of Hemant Patil Hemant Arjun Patil Office Address Associate Professor, Room No.4103, Faculty Block-4, Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology (DA-IICT), Gandhinagar-382 007, Gujarat, India. Tel: +91-79-30510650 Email: hemant_patil@daiict.ac.in, hemant_patil1977@yahoo.com Education Ph.D. (Signal Processing), Indian Institute of Technology, IIT Kharagpur, West Bengal, India, 2006. M.E. (Instrumentation), Shri Guru Gobind Singhji College of Engg. and Tech. (SGGS), SRTMU, Nanded, India, 2001. B.E. (Instrumentation), D. N. Patel COE, Shahada (Dist-Nandurbar), NMU, Jalgaon, India, 1999. Experience Lecturer, Dept. of Inst. Engg, Govt. COE, Jalgaon, August 2000-March 2001. Sr. Lecturer, Dept. of ETC, KIIT Bhubaneswar, Jan. 2005-August 2005. Asst. Prof. and Head, Dept. of EIE, Dr. B. C. Roy Engineering College, Durgapur, Sept. 2005- Feb. 2007. Asst. Prof.,  Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology (DA-IICT), Gandhinagar, Feb. 2007-till date. Short-Term Scholar, University of Minnesota, Twin Cities Campus, Minneapolis, USA, May-July 2009. Research Interest Speech Processing, Pattern Recognition, Voice Biometrics (Speaker Recogntion), Wavelet-based Signal Processing. Awards and Honours Awarded a grant of 6000 USD to visit Prof. Keshab K. Parhi’s research group at Department of ECE, University of Minnesota , Minneapolis, USA during May-July 2009. My student coauthor received a grant from International Speech Communication Association (ISCA) for registration of our joint paper at Interspeech 2008, Brisbane, Australia. The grant has been approved by Prof. Alan W. Black of Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, USA. Awarded summer research fellowship from Indian Academy of Sciences, Bangalore to work in the area of speaker recognition under guidance of Prof. B. Yegnanarayana of IIIT Hyderabad for the summer 2007. Awarded IBM Travel Grant to present a research paper in ICONIP 2004, LNCS 3316, Springer-Verlag, Berlin Heidelberg, Germany. Awarded institute scholarship (April 2001-Dec. 2004)  and teaching assistantship (April 2002-April 2003) during doctoral studies at IIT Kharagpur .
